result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason C. Allen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Schedule I, II Narcotics [Modifiers: Repeater], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. The defendant is to have NO CONTACT with Savanah Hilt.
Defendant is to comply with any rules/recommendations as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.   DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.

timeConds.notes: With Huber. No Good Time Credit.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

superMiscConds.notes: Defendant to obtain and maintain full time employment, unless medically excused by a treating physician.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.
Defendant is to comply with any rules/recommendations as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

Court re-imposes costs not previously paid. The defendant is ordered to authorize the Department of Corrections to collect from the defendant's wages and from other moneys held in the defendant's prisoner's account, an amount or percentage the department determines is reasonable for payment to victims.  In the event that the Defendant is revoked or discharged from probation with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the Court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement action will be used to collect the debt.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jason C. Allen

of Plea/Sentencing Hearing -- June 22, 2017

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
2:44 pm cases called. 15CF87, 16CM524, & 16CM539. Defendant Jason C. Allen in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Defendant Jason C. Allen in custody.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Agreement reached and stated on the record. Attorney Szilagyi confirms agreement. 16CM524 & 16CM539-  Defendant advised of potential punishment.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea:  No Contest to Count 1 of 16CM524 & No Contest to Count 1 of 16CM539. Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Court dismisses outright Count 2 of 16CM539 & Dismisses and reads-in Counts 3, 4, & 5 of 16CM539. Revocation Order and Warrant received by both counsel. Attorney Szilagyi makes statement regarding sentence credit. Argument by ADA Anderson. No statement by defendant. Court sentences the defendant to: 15CF87- 6 years Wisconsin State Prison to be served as 3 years Initial Confinement & 3 years Extended Supervision. Credit for 406 days. CONDITIONS: AODA and follow through, Absolute sobriety, Not to be on the premises of any bars, defendant is not to possess/nor ingest any impairing substance without a valid prescription from a treating physician. Full time employment. Terms of Agent. Re-imposes costs not previously paid to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. DOC authorization. Court finds the defendant eligible for CIP & SAP. 
16CM524- 10 days WCJ, with Huber and Good Time Credit. No credit for time served. Consecutive to 15CF87 & concurrent to 16CM539. Costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. 
16CM539- 45 days WCJ, with Huber and Good Time Credit. No credit for Time served. Concurrent to 15CF87. $1744.00 fine plus $42.50 blood draw fee to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. 24 mo DL revocation, 24 mo IID, OWI assessment.  DNA Sample and Surcharge ordered by the Court.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice. Appeal Rights Given.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on June 22, 2017 at 02:30 pm.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: 3:04 pm cases called. 15CF87 & 15CF167. Defendant Jason C. Allen in court with attorney Matthew Loren Goldin.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Agreement reached and stated on the record by DA. Attorney Goldin concurs. Preliminary hearing addressed-Defendant wishes to waive his right to a preliminary hearing. Court questions the defendant and accepts waiver of right to preliminary hearing. Court finds probable cause and enters an order binding the defendant over for trial. Information filed. Attorney Goldin confirms receipt, waives formal reading.   Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: No Contest to 15CF67. Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Court dismisses and reads-in 15CF167. Sentencing argument by DA Blader. Sentencing argument by Attorney Goldin.  Statement by defendant.  Court sentences the defendant to: SWD and places the defendant on probation for a period of 3 years. CONDITIONS: 10 months WCJ, with Huber, no Good Time Credit. Credit for 16 days served. No Contact with Co-defendant S. Hilt. AODA and follow through, The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. $300 Drug Buy Reimbursement Money. Terms of Agent. Costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan.  DNA Sample and Surcharge ordered.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice. Appeal Rights Given.

2:00 pm cases called. 15CF167, 15CF87, 09TR3705, 11CM544, 12CM83, 12CM115, & 13CM236 Defendant Jason C. Allen in court with attorney .  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 15CF167-  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Preliminary Hearing and Time Limits discussed. Defendant wishes to waive time limits for preliminary hearing. Court questions defendant and accepts waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing.   PLEAS Scheduled on 15CF167 & 15CF87 - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 18, 2015 at 02:45 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 11-18-2015 02:45 pm
Status conference at 11-04-2015 01:45 pm

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Matthew Loren Goldin in court appears telephonically.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Goldin requesting additional time to speak with his client. STC scheduled - DE must appear in person to address the unpaid financial obligations. Status conference scheduled for November 4, 2015 at 01:45 pm.
Status conference at 10-01-2015 02:30 pm

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Matthew Loren Goldin in court appears telephonically.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Jason C. Allen in court. Atty Goldin requesting another STC.  Status conference scheduled for October 1, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
Status conference at 09-01-2015 01:25 pm

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, except in furtherance of his employment at Lawsonia, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.  Complete ID process with the Sheriff's Department.
